references.paper_title: The equivalence of two extremum problems
references.reason: This paper introduces the Kiefer-Wolfowitz theorem, which is the foundation for the optimal design approach used in this paper.
This book provides a comprehensive overview of bandit algorithms, which are central to the theoretical analysis of the proposed methods.

references.paper_title: Rank analysis of incomplete block designs: I. the method of paired comparisons
references.reason: This paper introduces the Bradley-Terry-Luce model, a fundamental model for preference learning used in this paper.
This paper introduces the Plackett-Luce model, another fundamental model for preference learning used in this paper.

references.paper_title: Principled reinforcement learning with human feedback from pairwise or K-wise comparisons
references.reason: This paper is closely related to the current work, focusing on reinforcement learning from human feedback and providing a strong theoretical foundation for the proposed approach.
